google_reviews.review: Windermere Property Management has been keeping an eye on our rental. The entire process from first contact to receiving our monthly statement/payment has been professional, very easy, and without worry. Two thumbs up.

google_reviews.author: Crista Engom
google_reviews.review: Easy to work with. The property is kept in excellent condition. We love our home.

google_reviews.author: Terri Garrett
google_reviews.review: We used Windemere as our property management for three years. They were difficult to get ahold of and used different 'associate' managers, so there was very little consistency. That would have earned them a three star rating. But when we returned to our property, we were very disappointed with the condition of our home. Even more shocking was that they were willing to return the entire damage deposit to the renter despite obvious damage to our home (holes in drywall, smashed remote, etc). It became an exhausting process of emails back and forth. My 'favorite' part was having to digging through year of receipts to prove to 'my' property manager that I wan't lying when I said I'd purchased new stove knobs for the renter. I enthusiastically do not recommend.

ownerResponse.text: I was able to pull up the account and see it was eight years ago. I did address this with you at the time and unfortunately we had to 'agree to disagree'. I still stand by the deposit refund that was issued but understand you still feel the tenant was not charged enough. I am sincerely sorry, but I am governed by Washington State Landlord Tenant Laws and I charged for all items legally allowed (items that were above normal wear and tear). I do wish you didn't have a negative opinion of Windermere Property Management but it is your right to harbor your feelings. This is simply a situation I am not able to rectify.

google_reviews.author: Elisha Volanos
google_reviews.review: Rented an apartment from them for a year and decided to move into a house after my lease was up. Never in my life have I ever had a rental company keep all of my deposit. Long story short, they fired the manager, ignored my calls and 4 months down the road I talked to a construction crew member that repaired an area with water damage, in the apartment I had rented , keep in mind that I complained 6 months after moving in that I could hear dripping Every time the apartment above me ran their dishwasher. I've asked around and come to find out: not many renters like them or have received a deposit back --minus of course the usual charges for move out cleaning--. I truly hope the new staff has fixed this issue.

ownerResponse.text: Elisha, are you sure youve left a review on the correct Windermere office? Our records do not show you as a tenant in 2018 and our staff consists of only 2 people; both of us with the company multiple years. I take client satisfaction very seriously and am always here to discuss any concerns but again I do find you in our system. What town is the rental in?

google_reviews.author: Bev Martin
google_reviews.review: I sold my house June 2015 using Windermere Anacortes service's. Colleen Craig was my Realtor. I received amazing service from my Realtor and her associates in the office. I appreciated the excellent marketing of my home and the great follow through to closing. Colleen was exceptional at keeping me informed on the market and her marketing plan. I would highly recommend Colleen Craig and the Anacortes Windermere staff.

summary.text:
Good

In this article, we look into the positive experiences with Windermere Property Management / North Sound. A number of user reviews express satisfaction with the company's communication strategies and describe the team as friendly and respectful. Clients have felt pleased with the regular inspections and maintenance management carried out by Windermere. Particularly, the company's handling of rental properties over long periods, such as a decade for one reviewer, seems to be commendable, indicating consistency in service quality over time.

Furthermore, the company is praised for its professionalism and efficient process management. Clients have found the transition from initial contact to the monthly statements very smooth and worry-free. User reviews also commend Windermere for holding their investments in high regard, which has led to some property owners heavily endorsing their services based on several years of exceptional property management experience.

Great

Exemplary service delivery at Windermere Property Management / North Sound is highlighted in this section. User reviews applaud the proactiveness of the team, which apparently exceeds previous experiences with other property management companies. The attention to clients’ investment properties and ensuring they are kept in excellent condition are among the aspects highly rated by clients. Users have pointed to specific employees by name, acknowledging their effective and highly recommendable service.

The management's responsiveness to queries and swift problem resolution is another area where Windermere seems to excel. Clients appreciate the quick responses to their requests and the professional manner with which their concerns are handled. Such responsiveness is crucial in property management, and Windermere's ability to act promptly has been a defining trait that has led to multiple five-star reviews and strong recommendations from satisfied clients.

Bad

Despite many positive reviews, Windermere Property Management / North Sound has faced criticism from some clients. These negative experiences mainly revolve around communication hurdles and inconsistent management practices. One user review pointed out difficulties in reaching out to the company and a lack of consistently managed property due to the frequent changing of 'associate' managers. This led to dissatisfaction and a lower star rating by the user.

Ugly

The 'ugly' aspects mentioned in user reviews of Windermere Property Management / North Sound involve issues regarding the return of deposits and property conditions post-rental. A deeply negative experience shared by a client involved coming back to a poorly maintained property and facing reluctance from Windermere to withhold the renter’s deposit despite evident damage. This culminated in an exhausting back-and-forth communication process. Another account highlighted a situation where the entire deposit was kept, despite claims of reported maintenance issues during the tenancy that were not addressed, leading to questions about the fairness of deposit deductions and property maintenance follow-ups.
